alert.note: Alert for Estill; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 05 at 7:09PM EST until February 06 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... The Red River at Clay City, affecting Powell and Estill Counties. For the Red River...including Clay City...elevated river levels are occurring. ...A FLOOD ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...High water caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...The high water is along the Red River near Clay City. * WHEN...An advisory is in effect from this evening to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, low lying areas flood. Maple street near the Red River Ranch and Pompeii Road off of Highway 15 are impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM EST Saturday the stage was 16.5 feet, and it was falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.8 feet by Thursday morning. - Action stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 7 AM Sunday.
